info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 5:12PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern McDowell, southeastern Mitchell and west central Burke Counties through 600 PM EDT... At 512 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles north of Marion, or 6 miles northwest of Lake James, moving northeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lake James, Lake James State Park, B.R. Parkway-Little Switzerland To Linville, North Cove, Ashford, Little Switzerland, Woodlawn and Nebo. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
